Uses of Package
edu.luc.cs.trull.tl

Packages that use edu.luc.cs.trull.tl
edu.luc.cs.trull.demo Contains common classes used in the Triveni demos.  
edu.luc.cs.trull.tl Provides an implementation of temporal logic expressions in Java. 
 

Classes in edu.luc.cs.trull.tl used by edu.luc.cs.trull.demo
Expr
          The class Expr is the common abstract superclass for all temporal logic formula classes.
 

Classes in edu.luc.cs.trull.tl used by edu.luc.cs.trull.tl
AllPast
          The formula always p specifies that p must have been true for the entire past history of this system run.
And
          The formula l /\ r specifies that both l and r must be true in the current time unit.
BackTo
          The formula p backto q specifies that either p since q is true or always p is true.
Expr
          The class Expr is the common abstract superclass for all temporal logic formula classes.
Implies
          The formula p => q is defined as (!
Leaf
          The formula leaf l specifies that the current label is l.
Not
          The formula !
Once
          The formula once p specifies that p must have been true sometime in the history of this system run.
Or
          The formula p \/ q specifies that either p or q or both are true in the current time unit.
Previous
          The formula previous p specifies that p must have been true in the time unit immediately preceding the current one.
Since
          The formula p since q specifies that q must have been true sometime in the past history of this system run, and that p must have been true in every time unit since the last time q was true.
UniformVisitor
          A visitor that applies the same visit method to its argument without further traversal.
Visitor
          A visitor for temporal logic expressions.
VisitorAdapter
          An empty visitor implementation.
